<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
TAXES
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/04/22/biden-will-propose-nearly-doubling-capital-gains-tax?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Biden Makes It Easier to Have Diamond Hands
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/04/22/biden-will-propose-nearly-doubling-capital-gains-tax" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="Diamond hands" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC80ODI4L2RpYW1vbmRfaGFuZHMuanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">President Biden will soon propose <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-04-22/biden-to-propose-capital-gains-tax-as-high-as-43-4-for-wealthy?srnd=premium&sref=KkPzpZvz&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">nearly doubling</a> the capital gains tax for wealthy people to 39.6%, according to Bloomberg. Wealthy people = individuals earning $1 million or more.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Biden is expected to announce the tax hike next week as part of the pitch for his "American Families Plan," the highly anticipated sequel to the $2.3 trillion infrastructure proposal he released a few weeks ago. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>To pay for the first plan, which includes spending on bridges and broadband, Biden wants to hike taxes on corporations.</span></li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>To pay for his second proposal, which includes spending on childcare and paid leave for workers, he wants to hike taxes on wealthy investors.</span></li>
</ul>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Capital gains 101</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">You pay capital gains taxes on your profits from a savvy investment. For example, say in the summer of 2020 you listened to Roaring Kitty and bought GameStop at $4.50/share, then sold it this year at $150/share to buy courtside tickets to the Knicks' NBA Finals game—nice work, but you're going to have to pay taxes once you sell that stock.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Investments held for less than one year are taxed like regular income, but long-term capital gains (investments held for at least one year) have </span><span><a href="https://www.investopedia.com/articles/personal-finance/101515/comparing-longterm-vs-shortterm-capital-gain-tax-rates.asp?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">three tax brackets</a></span><span> that top out at just 20%.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Critics of the current capital gains system say, "So you're telling me this rich investor is paying <em>less</em> in taxes on their stock sales than a middle-class worker pays on their income? That doesn't sound right." Wealthy people with a majority of their net worth tied up in investments <em>do</em> benefit from the current system—Warren Buffett once said he's the <a href="https://money.cnn.com/2013/03/04/news/economy/buffett-secretary-taxes/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">lowest-paying taxpayer</a> in his office. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">But people who oppose raising capital gains taxes argue that the <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/opinion/articles/2020-10-23/biden-s-capital-gains-tax-plan-fixes-nothing?srnd=opinion&sref=KkPzpZvz&utm_content=view&cmpid%3D=socialflow-twitter-view&utm_campaign=socialflow-organic&utm_source=twitter&utm_medium=social&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">ripple effects</a> would be way worse, disincentivizing risk-taking, holding back economic growth, and discouraging investors from selling their assets, which is seen as keeping the market healthy. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line: </strong>Investors knew this dramatic hike was coming (the proposal was in candidate Biden's <a href="https://taxfoundation.org/joe-biden-tax-plan-2020/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">tax plan</a>), but the report jarred Wall Street nonetheless. It could lead to a <a href="https://www.axios.com/stocks-fall-on-reports-that-biden-wants-to-hike-taxes-on-capital-gains-ef2a1f13-5d41-4818-8fda-5882e748d6a8.html?utm_campaign=organic&utm_medium=socialshare&utm_source=twitter&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">lot of asset sales</a> before 2021's out, according to Axios. </p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
LEGAL
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/04/22/supreme-court-limits-ftcs-ability-recoup-illgotten-gains?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Supreme Court Picks Discipline Over Punishment
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">In a unanimous ruling yesterday, the Supreme Court <a href="https://www.politico.com/news/2021/04/22/9-0-supreme-court-ruling-guts-ftcs-ability-to-seek-redress-for-consumers-484194?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">said</a> the Federal Trade Commission does <em>not</em> have the authority to make companies give back profits made through deceptive or unfair practices, aka "ill-gotten gains." </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">For decades, the FTC has used a provision called Section 13(b) to recoup billions of dollars and (at times) pay back consumers. Problem is, 13(b) does't <em>explicitly</em> say the FTC is allowed to. So after the FTC ordered payday lender AMG Capital Management to return a record $1.3 billion to consumers in 2016, the company dug in its heels and appealed up the judicial ladder (around $500 million was distributed to consumers in 2018). </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Justices said the FTC needs to ask Congress to grant those powers back, which acting FTC Chair Rebecca Slaughter did earlier this week. Yesterday, Slaughter criticized the Court's decision for ruling "in favor of scam artists and dishonest corporations, leaving average Americans to pay for illegal behavior" and urged lawmakers to act quickly. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Big picture: </strong>If the FTC doesn't get its enforcement teeth back, wronged consumers will have fewer opportunities to collect damages and big corporations could get off easier in antitrust and privacy cases. </p>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
EV
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/04/22/tesla-struggles-upsets-china-week?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Tesla Bends the Knee to China
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/04/22/tesla-struggles-upsets-china-week" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="Tesla with wheel lock" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8zNzMzL3Rlc2xhX3dpdGhfd2hlZWxfbG9jay5qcGciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Tesla employees are preparing their epsom salt baths after a long week. On Monday, protestors <a href="https://www.cnn.com/2021/04/21/business/tesla-china-protest-shanghai-auto-show-intl-hnk/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">took over</a> the company's booth at the Shanghai Auto Show to voice complaints about vehicle malfunctions. One video of a woman climbing on top of a Tesla claiming faulty brakes caused a crash that injured her parents went viral. And over the course of the week, Tesla was battered by Chinese media after the EV company issued statements deemed "<a href="https://www.reuters.com/business/autos-transportation/teslas-bad-week-china-was-months-making-2021-04-22/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">insincere</a>."</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Big picture:</strong> China accounts for 30% of Tesla's sales, so CEO Elon Musk is motivated to make sure their gift basket has the good fruit in it (no honeydew). But the company's cavalier attitude and inability to keep up with auto repairs as sales grow rapidly have rubbed some Chinese regulators the wrong way.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>In March, Tesla cars were banned from military complexes in China over fears their cameras would be used to spy on the government. Musk insisted that would never happen.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line:</strong> If Tesla doesn't do some damage control in China, it could get <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/tesla-should-brace-for-impact-in-china-11619089646?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">lapped</a> by Western automakers like Volkswagen or homegrown Chinese upstarts like BYD, Nio, or Xpeng.</p>

<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Stat: </strong>2.8 million people in the US <a href="https://www.ft.com/content/7f33e9b9-2a4b-4562-98a0-1dd52e317abb?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">subscribed</a> to HBO Max in Q1; Netflix added just 450,000 subs across the US and Canada in the same period.   </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Quote: </strong>"In-person is way better than anything. It's like the major leagues versus sandlot ball."</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Fried Frank exec Jonathan Mechanic is one of many bigwig New Yorkers relieved to put down the homemade tuna sandwich and enjoy the return of the Midtown Manhattan "<a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/the-new-york-power-lunch-is-back-with-new-rules-11618766411?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">power lunch</a>," according to the WSJ. But things are a bit different in 2021: Desperate for social interaction, diners are lingering for longer and getting buzzed on cocktails or wine. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Read: </strong>There's a name for the blah you're feeling: languishing. (<a href="https://nyti.ms/3mX8Vm3?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">NYT</a>)</p>

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">

<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Many of you know Marques Brownlee, aka MKBHD, as one of the most authoritative tech reviewers on YouTube.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">What you may <em>not </em>know is that Brownlee has a team including a researcher, accountant, brand manager, script supervisor, and more. On our podcast <em>Business Casual</em>, Brownlee explained how he scaled his channel and his thoughts on the future of the “creator economy.” </p>

collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003ePresident Biden will soon propose \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-04-22/biden-to-propose-capital-gains-tax-as-high-as-43-4-for-wealthy?srnd=premium\u0026sref=KkPzpZvz\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003enearly doubling\u003c/a\u003e the capital gains tax for wealthy people to 39.6%, according to Bloomberg. Wealthy people = individuals earning $1 million or more.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBiden is expected to announce the tax hike next week as part of the pitch for his \"American Families Plan,\" the highly anticipated sequel to the $2.3 trillion infrastructure proposal he released a few weeks ago. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eTo pay for the first plan, which includes spending on bridges and broadband, Biden wants to hike taxes on corporations.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eTo pay for his second proposal, which includes spending on childcare and paid leave for workers, he wants to hike taxes on wealthy investors.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eCapital gains 101\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eYou pay capital gains taxes on your profits from a savvy investment. For example, say in the summer of 2020 you listened to Roaring Kitty and bought GameStop at $4.50/share, then sold it this year at $150/share to buy courtside tickets to the Knicks' NBA Finals game—nice work, but you're going to have to pay taxes once you sell that stock.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eInvestments held for less than one year are taxed like regular income, but long-term capital gains (investments held for at least one year) have \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.investopedia.com/articles/personal-finance/101515/comparing-longterm-vs-shortterm-capital-gain-tax-rates.asp?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ethree tax brackets\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e that top out at just 20%.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eCritics of the current capital gains system say, \"So you're telling me this rich investor is paying \u003cem\u003eless\u003c/em\u003e in taxes on their stock sales than a middle-class worker pays on their income? That doesn't sound right.\" Wealthy people with a majority of their net worth tied up in investments \u003cem\u003edo\u003c/em\u003e benefit from the current system—Warren Buffett once said he's the \u003ca href=\"https://money.cnn.com/2013/03/04/news/economy/buffett-secretary-taxes/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003elowest-paying taxpayer\u003c/a\u003e in his office. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBut people who oppose raising capital gains taxes argue that the \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/opinion/articles/2020-10-23/biden-s-capital-gains-tax-plan-fixes-nothing?srnd=opinion\u0026sref=KkPzpZvz\u0026utm_content=view\u0026cmpid%3D=socialflow-twitter-view\u0026utm_campaign=socialflow-organic\u0026utm_source=twitter\u0026utm_medium=social\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eripple effects\u003c/a\u003e would be way worse, disincentivizing risk-taking, holding back economic growth, and discouraging investors from selling their assets, which is seen as keeping the market healthy. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line: \u003c/strong\u003eInvestors knew this dramatic hike was coming (the proposal was in candidate Biden's \u003ca href=\"https://taxfoundation.org/joe-biden-tax-plan-2020/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003etax plan\u003c/a\u003e), but the report jarred Wall Street nonetheless. It could lead to a \u003ca href=\"https://www.axios.com/stocks-fall-on-reports-that-biden-wants-to-hike-taxes-on-capital-gains-ef2a1f13-5d41-4818-8fda-5882e748d6a8.html?utm_campaign=organic\u0026utm_medium=socialshare\u0026utm_source=twitter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003elot of asset sales\u003c/a\u003e before 2021's out, according to style=\"color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;\"\u003e\n\u003cfont color=\"#000000\"\u003e\nSupreme Court Picks Discipline Over Punishment\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIn a unanimous ruling yesterday, the Supreme Court \u003ca href=\"https://www.politico.com/news/2021/04/22/9-0-supreme-court-ruling-guts-ftcs-ability-to-seek-redress-for-consumers-484194?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esaid\u003c/a\u003e the Federal Trade Commission does \u003cem\u003enot\u003c/em\u003e have the authority to make companies give back profits made through deceptive or unfair practices, aka \"ill-gotten gains.\" \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eFor decades, the FTC has used a provision called Section 13(b) to recoup billions of dollars and (at times) pay back consumers. Problem is, 13(b) does't \u003cem\u003eexplicitly\u003c/em\u003e say the FTC is allowed to. So after the FTC ordered payday lender AMG Capital Management to return a record $1.3 billion to consumers in 2016, the company dug in its heels and appealed up the judicial ladder (around $500 million was distributed to consumers in 2018). \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eJustices said the FTC needs to ask Congress to grant those powers back, which acting FTC Chair Rebecca Slaughter did earlier this week. Yesterday, Slaughter criticized the Court's decision for ruling \"in favor of scam artists and dishonest corporations, leaving average Americans to pay for illegal behavior\" and urged lawmakers to act quickly. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBig picture: \u003c/strong\u003eIf the FTC doesn't get its enforcement teeth back, wronged consumers will have fewer opportunities to collect damages and big corporations could get off easier in antitrust and privacy cases. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eTesla employees are preparing their epsom salt baths after a long week. On Monday, protestors \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnn.com/2021/04/21/business/tesla-china-protest-shanghai-auto-show-intl-hnk/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003etook over\u003c/a\u003e the company's booth at the Shanghai Auto Show to voice complaints about vehicle malfunctions. One video of a woman climbing on top of a Tesla claiming faulty brakes caused a crash that injured her parents went viral. And over the course of the week, Tesla was battered by Chinese media after the EV company issued statements deemed \"\u003ca href=\"https://www.reuters.com/business/autos-transportation/teslas-bad-week-china-was-months-making-2021-04-22/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003einsincere\u003c/a\u003e.\"\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBig picture:\u003c/strong\u003e China accounts for 30% of Tesla's sales, so CEO Elon Musk is motivated to make sure their gift basket has the good fruit in it (no honeydew). But the company's cavalier attitude and inability to keep up with auto repairs as sales grow rapidly have rubbed some Chinese regulators the wrong way.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eIn March, Tesla cars were banned from military complexes in China over fears their cameras would be used to spy on the government. Musk insisted that would never happen.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line:\u003c/strong\u003e If Tesla doesn't do some damage control in China, it could get \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/tesla-should-brace-for-impact-in-china-11619089646?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003elapped\u003c/a\u003e by Western automakers like Volkswagen or homegrown Chinese upstarts like BYD, Nio, or Xpeng.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS
